original:
Lombard was part of a broader artistic community that included notable figures such as Gérard de Lairesse and Bertholet Flemalle. These artists played essential roles in shaping the visual landscape of the Prince-Bishopric of Liège. 

The Brueghel dynasty, particularly the works of Pieter Bruegel the Elder, significantly influenced Flemish genre painting. This style, characterized by its focus on peasant life and outdoor festivities, co
